alert.note: Alert for Orange; Seminole; Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 29 at 3:16AM EDT until September 29 at 6:15AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Melbourne has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Orange County in east central Florida... Seminole County in east central Florida... South Central Volusia County in east central Florida... * Until 615 AM EDT. * At 316 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain falling across the warned area. Between 6 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 4 to 6 inches are expected, with possible higher amounts, in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Orlando, Deltona, Sanford, Altamonte Springs, Oviedo, Winter Springs, Winter Park, DeLand, Casselberry, New Smyrna Beach, Maitland, Lake Mary, Longwood, Orange City, Lake Helen, Lake Jessup, DeBary, Geneva, Goldenrod and University Of Central Florida. This includes the following streams and drainages... Saint Johns River, Little Econlockhatchee River, Cow Creek, Wekiva River, Econlockhatchee River and Gee Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
